{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Procurement Officer",
  "description": "Cravecity Mega Limited is a Quick service restaurant, we offer excellent services with the best bites that satisfies every customers cravings. We encourage a favourable work environment by promoting a greatwork culture.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To source, negotiate, and purchase quality raw materials, packaging, beverages, equipment, and services at the best value, ensuring timely supply to meet QSR operational demands while maintaining cost efficiency and supplier compliance.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and evaluate suppliers to ensure quality, cost-effectiveness, and reliability.
	Negotiate pricing, payment terms, and supply agreements.
	Raise purchase orders (POs) and ensure timely approvals.
	Monitor inventory levels and liaise with the Stock Reconciliation Officer to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Maintain supplier database and performance records.
	Ensure procurement aligns with approved budgets and operational needs.
	Track deliveries, resolve shortages, and handle supplier-related issues.
	Ensure all purchases comply with company policies and quality standards.
	Support periodic supplier audits and product quality checks.
	Prepare and submit procurement reports to management.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum 2&ndash;5years of experience in procurement, preferably in QSR or FMCG.
	Strong negotiation and supplier management skills.
	Knowledge of food safety and quality standards.
	Proficiency in MS Office and inventory management tools.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and cost-consciousness


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrbp@cravecityng.com&nbsp;using &quot;Procurement QSR&quot; as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07017425977.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-16",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Cravecity Mega Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185928"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }

}



Senior Procurement Officer Job at Cravecity Mega Limited




        
    

        
        Cravecity Mega Limited is a Quick service restaurant, we offer excellent services with the best bites that satisfies every customers cravings. We encourage a favourable work environment by promoting a greatwork culture.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Procurement Officer

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	To source, negotiate, and purchase quality raw materials, packaging, beverages, equipment, and services at the best value, ensuring timely supply to meet QSR operational demands while maintaining cost efficiency and supplier compliance.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and evaluate suppliers to ensure quality, cost-effectiveness, and reliability.
	Negotiate pricing, payment terms, and supply agreements.
	Raise purchase orders (POs) and ensure timely approvals.
	Monitor inventory levels and liaise with the Stock Reconciliation Officer to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Maintain supplier database and performance records.
	Ensure procurement aligns with approved budgets and operational needs.
	Track deliveries, resolve shortages, and handle supplier-related issues.
	Ensure all purchases comply with company policies and quality standards.
	Support periodic supplier audits and product quality checks.
	Prepare and submit procurement reports to management.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum 2–5years of experience in procurement, preferably in QSR or FMCG.
	Strong negotiation and supplier management skills.
	Knowledge of food safety and quality standards.
	Proficiency in MS Office and inventory management tools.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and cost-consciousness


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@cravecityng.com using "Procurement QSR" as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07017425977.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Assistant / Offloader",
  "description": "Welcome U Shopping Centre is a reputable shopping center in the heart of the city, Port Harcourt. It has over five branches and deals mainly on retail trade and general supplies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant / Offloader
Job Location:&nbsp;Iwofe, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Offloader is responsible for efficiently unloading goods from delivery vehicles, ensuring products are handled safely, and assisting with proper placement and storage within the warehouse.
	This role requires physical strength, attention to detail, and teamwork to maintain smooth warehouse operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely unload goods from trucks and other delivery vehicles.
	Inspect items during offloading for damages or discrepancies.
	Move, sort, and arrange goods in designated storage areas.
	Assist in stock counting and inventory checks when required.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse and loading area.
	Follow safety guidelines to prevent accidents or product damage.
	Support warehouse staff in daily operations as needed.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE.
	Prior experience in offloading, warehouse, or logistics roles is an added advantage.
	Must reside within Iwofe and its environs.
	Ability to lift and move heavy goods repeatedly.
	Physical stamina and endurance.
	Strong teamwork and communication skills.
	Punctual and dependable.


Work Conditions:


	Physical work involving lifting, bending, and standing for extended periods.
	May require working early mornings or late evenings, depending on delivery schedules.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Details / CV to:&nbsp;welcomeuiwofe@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
Or apply in person to:
Welcome U Shopping Centre,
Iwofe Branch.

Note


	For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 08163685168.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-08-21",

  },

Warehouse Assistant / Offloader Job at Welcome U Shopping Centre




        
    

        
        Welcome U Shopping Centre is a reputable shopping center in the heart of the city, Port Harcourt. It has over five branches and deals mainly on retail trade and general supplies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant / Offloader
Job Location: Iwofe, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Warehouse Offloader is responsible for efficiently unloading goods from delivery vehicles, ensuring products are handled safely, and assisting with proper placement and storage within the warehouse.
	This role requires physical strength, attention to detail, and teamwork to maintain smooth warehouse operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely unload goods from trucks and other delivery vehicles.
	Inspect items during offloading for damages or discrepancies.
	Move, sort, and arrange goods in designated storage areas.
	Assist in stock counting and inventory checks when required.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse and loading area.
	Follow safety guidelines to prevent accidents or product damage.
	Support warehouse staff in daily operations as needed.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE.
	Prior experience in offloading, warehouse, or logistics roles is an added advantage.
	Must reside within Iwofe and its environs.
	Ability to lift and move heavy goods repeatedly.
	Physical stamina and endurance.
	Strong teamwork and communication skills.
	Punctual and dependable.


Work Conditions:


	Physical work involving lifting, bending, and standing for extended periods.
	May require working early mornings or late evenings, depending on delivery schedules.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Details / CV to: welcomeuiwofe@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
Or apply in person to:
Welcome U Shopping Centre,
Iwofe Branch.

Note


	For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 08163685168.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operational Manager",
  "description": "LEAM Consulting is the foremost consulting firm which stands out in areas of professional certification training, HR advisory services, Business Development/Startup and IT consulting services in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operational Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Ifako Ijaiye, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for an operational manager who will take charge of managing staff, overseeing inventory, and elevating customer service to guarantee a positive shopping experience.


Responsibilities


	Manage the supermarket&#39;s budget, including monitoring expenses and minimizing waste.
	Ensure that the store is properly stocked with products and manage inventory levels to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Hire, train, and supervise staff, ensuring that they provide excellent customer service and follow company policies and procedures.
	Monitor and analyze sales and customer data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
	Collaborate with suppliers and negotiate contracts to ensure competitive pricing and quality products.


Qualifications


	HND/B.Sc in Business Administration, Management,or a related field.
	2-3 years of experience as an operational Manager or related experience.
	Strong leadership and management skills to effectively lead and motivate a team.
	Knowledge of supermarket operations, including merchandising, inventory control, and customer service.
	Problem-solving and decision-making skills to address issues promptly and effectively.


Salary
N150,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hiring@leamconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-16",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-31",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "LEAM Consulting"
    
  },

Operational Manager Job at LEAM Consulting




        
    

        
        LEAM Consulting is the foremost consulting firm which stands out in areas of professional certification training, HR advisory services, Business Development/Startup and IT consulting services in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operational Manager
Job Location: Ifako Ijaiye, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for an operational manager who will take charge of managing staff, overseeing inventory, and elevating customer service to guarantee a positive shopping experience.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage the supermarket's budget, including monitoring expenses and minimizing waste.
	Ensure that the store is properly stocked with products and manage inventory levels to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Hire, train, and supervise staff, ensuring that they provide excellent customer service and follow company policies and procedures.
	Monitor and analyze sales and customer data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
	Collaborate with suppliers and negotiate contracts to ensure competitive pricing and quality products.


Qualifications


	HND/B.Sc in Business Administration, Management,or a related field.
	2-3 years of experience as an operational Manager or related experience.
	Strong leadership and management skills to effectively lead and motivate a team.
	Knowledge of supermarket operations, including merchandising, inventory control, and customer service.
	Problem-solving and decision-making skills to address issues promptly and effectively.


Salary
N150,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hiring@leamconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Get same treatment in Nigeria as in US, UK and India. 18 Years in Eye Care. HMO Empanelled Hospitals

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintaining accurate, complete health care records and reports.
	To act as relationship officer with HMOs/NHIS
	To obtain all necessary HMO codes as at when due
	Ensure completion of all documentation for HMOs and the timely submission of bills
	Explain benefits, eligibility status, enrollment processing procedures and status of authorizations and referrals to enrollees and Providers.
	Recording patient vital signs and medical information.
	To managepatient information, medical histories, physician exams, test results, treatments and services provided.
	To record information and keep file folders and electronic databases up-to-date
	To organize and maintain health information both in paper files and in electronic systems.
	Other clerical duties as assigned by the manager


Requirements


	Minimum of a Degree in Health Information Management with at least 2 years of working experience.
	Working knowledge of QuickBooks and ERP will be an added advantage.


Applicant must possess the following skills:


	Computer literacy
	Time Management
	Organization
	Attention to Detail
	Quality Focus
	Professionalism
	Productivity
	Deadline-Oriented
	Skilful Communicator
	Reporting Skills


Method of Application

HMO Officer Job at Skipper Eye-Q Super Speciality Eye Hospital




        
    

        
        Skipper Eye-Q Super Speciality Eye hospital is an International Eye Hospital chain with the presence of 30 in India and 4 in Nigeria. All types of Eye Surgeries such as Cataract, Retina, Glaucoma, presbyopia, cornea, squint, refractive error and other vision problems, having treated 10+ Million patients. Get same treatment in Nigeria as in US, UK and India. 18 Years in Eye Care. HMO Empanelled Hospitals

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO Officer
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintaining accurate, complete health care records and reports.
	To act as relationship officer with HMOs/NHIS
	To obtain all necessary HMO codes as at when due
	Ensure completion of all documentation for HMOs and the timely submission of bills
	Explain benefits, eligibility status, enrollment processing procedures and status of authorizations and referrals to enrollees and Providers.
	Recording patient vital signs and medical information.
	To managepatient information, medical histories, physician exams, test results, treatments and services provided.
	To record information and keep file folders and electronic databases up-to-date
	To organize and maintain health information both in paper files and in electronic systems.
	Other clerical duties as assigned by the manager


Requirements


	Minimum of a Degree in Health Information Management with at least 2 years of working experience.
	Working knowledge of QuickBooks and ERP will be an added advantage.


Applicant must possess the following skills:


	Computer literacy
	Time Management
	Organization
	Attention to Detail
	Quality Focus
	Professionalism
	Productivity
	Deadline-Oriented
	Skilful Communicator
	Reporting Skills


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send CV and applications to: skippereyeqhospitals@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Dedicated Banking",
  "description": "At BridgeGap Consult Limited, we deliver superior outcomes for businesses in complex markets while leveraging on a wide range of industry experts and experience. We work closely with teams to establish relationships while still evaluating and expanding growth opportunities for our clients.&nbsp;Our solutions are customized to meet the needs and uniqueness of our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Dedicated Banking

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	The Head Dedicated Banking is responsible for leading and managing the Dedicated Banking unit within the Retail and SME Banking group.
	This role involves developing and implementing strategies to drive product sales, enhance customer relationships, and achieve growth in both volume and value of accounts, aligning with the bank&#39;s objectives.


Key Roles and Responsibilities


	Develop and execute strategic plans to promote the bank&#39;s products and services, ensuring alignment with the overall goals of the Retail and SME Banking division.
	Act as a trusted advisor on financial matters, addressing client inquiries effectively and resolving complaints promptly to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.
	Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, business heads, and internal stakeholders to drive product sales and customer acquisition within targeted markets.
	Oversee the promotion, cross-selling, and upselling of the bank&#39;s products to maximize revenue generation. &middot; Implement marketing strategies and programs designed to boost profitability and achieve set deposit targets by securing business and investment deals from individuals and corporate entities.
	Ensure the creation of quality risk assets to meet established targets, including packaging customer credit requests in line with the bank&#39;s credit policies and procedures.
	Monitor customer compliance with credit agreements and ensure adherence to Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements.
	Lead and manage the Dedicated Banking team, including planning marketing calls, monitoring performance against plans, and fostering a culture of high-quality client service and customer retention.


Experience and Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related discipline from a recognized university.
	A minimum of 8 years of banking experience in sales and credit, with at least 5 years in a senior role within operations management.
	A postgraduate qualification or relevant professional certification is an added advantage.
	Comprehensive knowledge of basic accounting and financial analysis, business law, business/financial advisory services, banking operations, leasing, trade services, and relevant banking laws and regulations.
	Proficiency in credit risk assessment and analysis, relationship management, networking, business writing, and presentation skills.
	A solid understanding of economic trends and their implications for the banking and finance sector.


Required Skills and Competencies:


	Strong business acumen and analytical skills.
	Excellent relationship management and interpersonal abilities.
	Proficiency in computer programs, including MS Word and Excel.
	In-depth understanding of business processes.
	Keen attention to detail.
	Enthusiastic and passionate commitment to delivering exceptional customer service.
	Proactive decision-making capabilities.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Unquestionable integrity and a high level of commitment.


Salary
Negotiable.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;sajiboye@bridgegapconsults.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Head, Dedicated Banking Job at BridgeGap Consult Limited




        
    

        
        At BridgeGap Consult Limited, we deliver superior outcomes for businesses in complex markets while leveraging on a wide range of industry experts and experience. We work closely with teams to establish relationships while still evaluating and expanding growth opportunities for our clients. Our solutions are customized to meet the needs and uniqueness of our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Dedicated Banking

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	The Head Dedicated Banking is responsible for leading and managing the Dedicated Banking unit within the Retail and SME Banking group.
	This role involves developing and implementing strategies to drive product sales, enhance customer relationships, and achieve growth in both volume and value of accounts, aligning with the bank's objectives.


Key Roles and Responsibilities


	Develop and execute strategic plans to promote the bank's products and services, ensuring alignment with the overall goals of the Retail and SME Banking division.
	Act as a trusted advisor on financial matters, addressing client inquiries effectively and resolving complaints promptly to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.
	Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, business heads, and internal stakeholders to drive product sales and customer acquisition within targeted markets.
	Oversee the promotion, cross-selling, and upselling of the bank's products to maximize revenue generation. · Implement marketing strategies and programs designed to boost profitability and achieve set deposit targets by securing business and investment deals from individuals and corporate entities.
	Ensure the creation of quality risk assets to meet established targets, including packaging customer credit requests in line with the bank's credit policies and procedures.
	Monitor customer compliance with credit agreements and ensure adherence to Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements.
	Lead and manage the Dedicated Banking team, including planning marketing calls, monitoring performance against plans, and fostering a culture of high-quality client service and customer retention.


Experience and Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related discipline from a recognized university.
	A minimum of 8 years of banking experience in sales and credit, with at least 5 years in a senior role within operations management.
	A postgraduate qualification or relevant professional certification is an added advantage.
	Comprehensive knowledge of basic accounting and financial analysis, business law, business/financial advisory services, banking operations, leasing, trade services, and relevant banking laws and regulations.
	Proficiency in credit risk assessment and analysis, relationship management, networking, business writing, and presentation skills.
	A solid understanding of economic trends and their implications for the banking and finance sector.


Required Skills and Competencies:


	Strong business acumen and analytical skills.
	Excellent relationship management and interpersonal abilities.
	Proficiency in computer programs, including MS Word and Excel.
	In-depth understanding of business processes.
	Keen attention to detail.
	Enthusiastic and passionate commitment to delivering exceptional customer service.
	Proactive decision-making capabilities.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Unquestionable integrity and a high level of commitment.


Salary
Negotiable.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: sajiboye@bridgegapconsults.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
